cab.content: (This Document is the PropertyHis Britannic M-ajesty's Government.)Circulated by the Secretary of State for India.SECRET. From Viceroy, 4ih February 1918. (Received 5th February, 10.30 a.m.)i--^''Secret. Weekly report. North-West Frontier quiet except for kid- napping of two Kuram Militia men by Khost outlaws. Burma-Assam border. Conditions in Manipur area remain unsettled. In Southern Manipur two Military Police columns suffered about 20 casualties including two British officers wounded. Punitive measures [?]. Situation in Chin Hills area is quiet. General military situation unchanged.
